nodes.text: A pressure resuscitator was a medical tool that assisted with breathing. The resuscitator was affixed over a patient's face, allowing a decompression tube to automatically enter the trachea and feed into the lungs. After suffering a venticular fibrillation, Morgan Q. Raventhorn was treated with a pressure resuscitator by Maglenna Pendower in an effort to restart Raventhorn's breathing. Used together with an adrenaline patch and adhesive defrib strip, Pendower was successful in saving Raventhorn's life.
